main event: A retired physicist reported seeing an oval or round object, about 10-15 feet long, that was reflecting the sky. The object hung in the air for a few minutes before taking off at a high speed and disappearing from view.
interesting points: The object made no noise and left no trail.
The witness, a retired, fairly well-known physicist, was hesitant to definitively identify the object, stating that it was just a momentary sighting and he could not be sure what it was.
The witness indicated that the object was some kind of unknown object, and not a conventional aircraft.
The sighting occurred on two different days in the same spot in the sky.
The object was described as a round, shiny object like the sun, reflecting light.
sighted object: an oval or round object, about 10-15 feet long, reflecting the sky
